title: Holiday’s final act - Thu, 01 Oct 2015 PST
text:
Tags: FC Kansas City Lauren Holiday National Women’s Soccer League Seattle Reign soccer 
The National Women’s Soccer League championship game symbolizes an end and a beginning for Lauren Holiday. The 28-year-old midfielder for FC Kansas City is retiring from soccer following the title game Thursday night against the Seattle Reign in Portland ( 6:30 p.m., Fox Sports 1 ). Holiday announced plans … 
The National Women’s Soccer League championship game symbolizes an end and a beginning for Lauren Holiday. The 28-year-old midfielder for FC Kansas City is retiring from soccer following the title game Thursday night against the Seattle Reign in Portland ( 6:30 p.m., Fox Sports 1 ). Holiday announced plans to step away from the game in July, shortly after winning the FIFA Women’s World Cup with the U.S. national team. But she vowed to first finish out the season with her NWSL club. Holiday was also on the Kansas City team that defeated the Reign 2-1 in last season’s championship in Seattle. – Associated Press
